title: How to Make Natural Hairspray

steps.headline: Fill a pot with 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
steps.description: This will take 6-8 minutes depending on your stovetop. Covering the pot while it heats up can make it boil a bit faster.

steps.headline: Stir in 2 tablespoons of sugar until sugar is dissolved.
steps.description: While the water is at a boil, add the sugar. Keep stirring until the sugar is completely dissolved and you can’t see any granules in the water.

steps.headline: Remove the pot from heat and turn off the burner.
steps.description: Once the sugar is dissolved completely, you can remove the pot from heat. Place it on a nearby burner or potholder. Make sure the all of burners on the stove are turned off.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
steps.description: Be patient, as this can take 5-10 minutes. Check on the temperature after 5 minutes by putting a finger in the water, and if it’s still warm, let it sit for another 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add ½ tablespoon of rubbing alcohol for extra hold.
steps.description: This step is optional, but if you would like extra hold to tame your hair, you can add rubbing alcohol. Stir thoroughly after adding the alcohol to the water.

steps.headline: Add 10-20 drops of the essential oils of your choice for a pleasant scent.
steps.description: Popular essential oils added to hairspray include lavender, geranium, grapefruit, rosemary, and peppermint. Stir thoroughly after adding them. You can choose your favorites and add as much or as little as you’d like, as long as you use between 10-20 drops. Using more might be too overpowering and make your hairspray less effective.

steps.headline: Place the funnel in the opening of the bottle and pour in the hairspray slowly.
steps.description: Be careful not to overfill the funnel or the bottle. If you have some leftover, store it in an airtight container to refill your spray bottle later.

steps.headline: Replace the spray nozzle and shake well.
steps.description: Your new hair spray is ready to use immediately. You can do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working well, either into the air or onto the back of your hand.

steps.headline: Melt 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a pot.
steps.description: Keep the pot on a medium heat until the coconut oil is melted completely. It should melt fairly quickly, so keep your eye on it.

steps.headline: Remove the pot from heat and add 2 cups of water.
steps.description: While the coconut oil is still melted, add two cups of water to the oil and mix thoroughly. The oil will not dissolve in the water. You won’t be placing the pot back on the burner, so it’s safe to turn off the heat at this point.

steps.headline: Stir in 3-4 drops of rosemary essential oil.
steps.description: The essential oil will dissolve in the water once stirred. This adds a pleasant smell and helps to nourish the hair.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
steps.description: Let the mixture sit for a 5-10 minutes to cool to room temperature. It may need to be stirred again after sitting for a bit.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the funnel placed in the opening of the bottle.
steps.description: Work slowly and make sure you don’t overfill the bottle. You can store any remaining mixture in an airtight container to refill your bottle later. If refrigerated, your extra mixture can last up to 2 weeks. Once the mixture gets cloudy, you should throw it away and make a new batch.

steps.headline: Tighten the spray nozzle and shake the bottle.
steps.description: Your new hairspray is ready to use immediately. Do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working correctly and doesn’t get clogged with the oil when you spray. If it does get clogged, try using a different bottle with a larger tube attached to the spray nozzle.

tyn: 1 spray bottle with a fine mist nozzle
text: Sugar Hairspray Fill a pot with 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil. This will take 6-8 minutes depending on your stovetop. Covering the pot while it heats up can make it boil a bit faster. Stir in 2 tablespoons of sugar until sugar is dissolved. While the water is at a boil, add the sugar. Keep stirring until the sugar is completely dissolved and you can’t see any granules in the water. Remove the pot from heat and turn off the burner. Once the sugar is dissolved completely, you can remove the pot from heat. Place it on a nearby burner or potholder. Make sure the all of burners on the stove are turned off. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature. Be patient, as this can take 5-10 minutes. Check on the temperature after 5 minutes by putting a finger in the water, and if it’s still warm, let it sit for another 2-3 minutes. Add ½ tablespoon of rubbing alcohol for extra hold. This step is optional, but if you would like extra hold to tame your hair, you can add rubbing alcohol. Stir thoroughly after adding the alcohol to the water. Add 10-20 drops of the essential oils of your choice for a pleasant scent. Popular essential oils added to hairspray include lavender, geranium, grapefruit, rosemary, and peppermint. Stir thoroughly after adding them. You can choose your favorites and add as much or as little as you’d like, as long as you use between 10-20 drops. Using more might be too overpowering and make your hairspray less effective. Place the funnel in the opening of the bottle and pour in the hairspray slowly. Be careful not to overfill the funnel or the bottle. If you have some leftover, store it in an airtight container to refill your spray bottle later. Replace the spray nozzle and shake well. Your new hair spray is ready to use immediately. You can do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working well, either into the air or onto the back of your hand. Coconut and Rosemary Hairspray Melt 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a pot. Keep the pot on a medium heat until the coconut oil is melted completely. It should melt fairly quickly, so keep your eye on it. Remove the pot from heat and add 2 cups of water. While the coconut oil is still melted, add two cups of water to the oil and mix thoroughly. The oil will not dissolve in the water. You won’t be placing the pot back on the burner, so it’s safe to turn off the heat at this point. Stir in 3-4 drops of rosemary essential oil. The essential oil will dissolve in the water once stirred. This adds a pleasant smell and helps to nourish the hair. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature. Let the mixture sit for a 5-10 minutes to cool to room temperature. It may need to be stirred again after sitting for a bit. Pour the mixture into the funnel placed in the opening of the bottle. Work slowly and make sure you don’t overfill the bottle. You can store any remaining mixture in an airtight container to refill your bottle later. If refrigerated, your extra mixture can last up to 2 weeks. Once the mixture gets cloudy, you should throw it away and make a new batch. Tighten the spray nozzle and shake the bottle. Your new hairspray is ready to use immediately. Do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working correctly and doesn’t get clogged with the oil when you spray. If it does get clogged, try using a different bottle with a larger tube attached to the spray nozzle.
sentences: Sugar Hairspray Fill a pot with 2 cups of water and bring it to a boil.
This will take 6-8 minutes depending on your stovetop.
Covering the pot while it heats up can make it boil a bit faster.
Stir in 2 tablespoons of sugar until sugar is dissolved.
While the water is at a boil, add the sugar.
Keep stirring until the sugar is completely dissolved and you can’t see any granules in the water.
Remove the pot from heat and turn off the burner.
Once the sugar is dissolved completely, you can remove the pot from heat.
Place it on a nearby burner or potholder.
Make sure the all of burners on the stove are turned off.
Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
Be patient, as this can take 5-10 minutes.
Check on the temperature after 5 minutes by putting a finger in the water, and if it’s still warm, let it sit for another 2-3 minutes.
Add ½ tablespoon of rubbing alcohol for extra hold.
This step is optional, but if you would like extra hold to tame your hair, you can add rubbing alcohol.
Stir thoroughly after adding the alcohol to the water.
Add 10-20 drops of the essential oils of your choice for a pleasant scent.
Popular essential oils added to hairspray include lavender, geranium, grapefruit, rosemary, and peppermint.
Stir thoroughly after adding them.
You can choose your favorites and add as much or as little as you’d like, as long as you use between 10-20 drops.
Using more might be too overpowering and make your hairspray less effective.
Place the funnel in the opening of the bottle and pour in the hairspray slowly.
Be careful not to overfill the funnel or the bottle.
If you have some leftover, store it in an airtight container to refill your spray bottle later.
Replace the spray nozzle and shake well.
Your new hair spray is ready to use immediately.
You can do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working well, either into the air or onto the back of your hand.
Coconut and Rosemary Hairspray Melt 2 tablespoons of coconut oil in a pot.
Keep the pot on a medium heat until the coconut oil is melted completely.
It should melt fairly quickly, so keep your eye on it.
Remove the pot from heat and add 2 cups of water.
While the coconut oil is still melted, add two cups of water to the oil and mix thoroughly.
The oil will not dissolve in the water.
You won’t be placing the pot back on the burner, so it’s safe to turn off the heat at this point.
Stir in 3-4 drops of rosemary essential oil.
The essential oil will dissolve in the water once stirred.
This adds a pleasant smell and helps to nourish the hair.
Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature.
Let the mixture sit for a 5-10 minutes to cool to room temperature.
It may need to be stirred again after sitting for a bit.
Pour the mixture into the funnel placed in the opening of the bottle.
Work slowly and make sure you don’t overfill the bottle.
You can store any remaining mixture in an airtight container to refill your bottle later.
If refrigerated, your extra mixture can last up to 2 weeks.
Once the mixture gets cloudy, you should throw it away and make a new batch.
Tighten the spray nozzle and shake the bottle.
Your new hairspray is ready to use immediately.
Do a few test sprays to make sure the nozzle is working correctly and doesn’t get clogged with the oil when you spray.
If it does get clogged, try using a different bottle with a larger tube attached to the spray nozzle.
